learning_outcomes.description: Understand and appreciate the scientific and research base of psychology.
Understand and appreciate basic research designs and their applications.
Understand and appreciate measurement in psychology research.
Understand and appreciate the ways and means of exploring, displaying, describing and analysing research data.
Design and conduct a simple research study.
Understand and appreciate scientific report writing in psychology.

assessments.weighting: <dd>20% 40 multiple choice questions each worth 0.5 marks. </dd>
assessments.due_date:
In-semester Saturday

29/03/2025 - 12/04/2025

Exam will be held on 29 March, 05 April, or 12 April
assessments.task_description: Exam covers material from Lecture 1 to Lecture 4 inclusive.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This Quiz will be accessed via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: Research report based on data collected in tutorials.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This report should be submitted via Turnitin on the course Blackboard site. Please keep a copy of your submission receipt.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.weighting: <dd>45% 45 multiple choice questions each worth 1 mark </dd>
assessments.task_description: Final exam covering material from the entire course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: The quiz is open for 48hrs. No late submissions will be accepted.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.weighting: <dd>10% 1% per quiz. Best 10 quizzes count towards the final grade. </dd>
assessments.task_description:
Weekly quizzes will be comprised of a small set of multiple choice or short answer questions that test students' knowledge of the material from PSYC1040 that they have been assigned in preparation for that week's classes. This material includes the Grove (2022) PDF chapters, modules on the edX(Edge) platform, the assigned chapters from the Aron, Aron & Coups (6th Ed) textbook, and material covered in lectures up to and including that week. Therefore, students should do the assigned readings, suggested practice questions, and watch the videos for that week prior to attempting the quiz.


Each weekly quiz will open at 1pm following the lecture and remain open for 48 hours. You must complete and submit the quiz before 1pm on the Sunday following the lecture.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: The quiz is open for 48hrs. No late submissions will be accepted.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Course Overview and Principles of Research

An introduction to the course and general principles of research.

Reading: Grove (2022) PDF Chapter 1: The Scientific Process and Experimental Design.

This PDF is available on the PSYC1040 Blackboard page.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Course Overview and Principles of Research An introduction to the course and general principles of research. Reading: Grove (2022) PDF Chapter 1: The Scientific Process and Experimental Design. This PDF is available on the PSYC1040 Blackboard page.

learning_activities.topic:
Basic Study Designs 1

Introduction to basic study designs, including between groups experiments, quasi-experiments, correlations, etc.

Reading: Grove (2022) PDF Chapter 2: The Scientific Process and Experimental Design.


Learning outcomes: L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Basic Study Designs 1 Introduction to basic study designs, including between groups experiments, quasi-experiments, correlations, etc. Reading: Grove (2022) PDF Chapter 2: The Scientific Process and Experimental Design.

Basic Study Designs 2

Introduction to basic study designs, including within groups experiments.

Reading: Grove (2022) PDF Chapter 1&2: The Scientific Process and Experimental Design.


Learning outcomes: L03

learning_activities.topic:
Measurement, Frequency Distributions & Percentiles

Measurement scales, issues related to measurement, displaying data, working out percentiles.

Reading:

Reading: Grove (2022) PDF Chapter 2: The Scientific Process and Experimental Design.

Textbook: Aron et al. (2023) Chapter 1


Learning outcomes: L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Measurement, Frequency Distributions & Percentiles Measurement scales, issues related to measurement, displaying data, working out percentiles. Reading: Reading: Grove (2022) PDF Chapter 2: The Scientific Process and Experimental Design. Textbook: Aron et al. (2023) Chapter 1

learning_activities.topic:
Central Tendency & Variability

Introduction to the three measures of central tendency: mode, median, and mean. Introduction to measures of variability: range, variance, standard deviation.

Textbook: Aron et al. (2023) Chapter 2.


Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Central Tendency & Variability Introduction to the three measures of central tendency: mode, median, and mean. Introduction to measures of variability: range, variance, standard deviation. Textbook: Aron et al. (2023) Chapter 2.
